[@kas](@dBQlwh9Gtr3i5YMOGtIOKtGNVepeu+nyb6KGl1vtOcM=.ed25519) 

I know there's a military term called [bottom line up front](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BLUF_(communication)), plus there are likely some parallels with [inverted pyramids](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inverted_pyramid_(journalism)). How did you like D-prime? I've never tried E-prime for more than a few minutes, but it seems like most of the value comes from removing "is" from identity and predication.

[@squicc](@k9xSaKW2kc+Ko8Vx+xvFmVC5gEi/tIA2TpV6EBQ7MPw=.ed25519) 

I think you're onto something -- and I forgot how frustrating those sentences are. Maybe [happy path](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Happy_path) sentences or [desire path](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desire_path) sentences would be more appropriate? I'm surprised that this isn't already a thing.
